Award.AbstractNarration: This award is made as part of the FY 2016 Mathematical Sciences Postdoctoral Research Fellowships Program. Each of the fellowships supports a research and training project at a host institution in the mathematical sciences, including applications to other disciplines, under the mentorship of a sponsoring scientist. The title of the project for this fellowship to Katrina Honigs is "Arithmetic Derived Algebraic Geometry." The host institution for the fellowship is the University of Utah, and the sponsoring scientist is Aaron Bertram.

ProgramReference.Text: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

POR.DRECONTENT:
My GRFP proposal was focused on characterizing derived equivalence, particularly of varieties that are defined over fields other than the complex numbers. My award had numerous outcomes related to this goal. I wrote and published many papers on this subject in the period of September 2016 - August 2020. 
My paper "Derived equivalence, Albanese varieties, and the zeta functions of 3-dimensional varieties'',  joint with Achter, Casalaina-Martin and Vial was published in Proceedings of the American math society, and my paper "Derived equivalences of canonical covers of hyperelliptic and Enriques surfaces in positive characteristic'' joint with L. Lombardi and S. Tirabassi. was published in Mathematische Zeitschrift. The paper "Fourier--Mukai partners of Enriques and bielliptic surfaces in positive characteristic", joint with M. Lieblich and S. Tirabassi, was written and was approved for publication in Mathematical  Research Letters. The paper ``Rational points and derived equivalence'', joint with  N. Addington, B. Antieau and S. Frei was written and posted to the arxiv, and has been submitted for publication. As of August 2020, I have two additional papers in preparation. One of these is called ``A transcendental topologically-nontrivial Brauer-Manin obstruction to weak approximation on a Calabi-Yau threefold'', joint with S. Hashimoto, A. Lamarche and I. Vogt. It concerns Q-rational points on some Calabi-Yau threefolds which we became aware of because of their use in other work about derived equivalences. The other paper is joint with S. Frei and concerns comparing cohomology of generalized Kummer surfaces and moduli of stable sheaves on abelian varieties over any field. This paper does not deal directly with derived equivalence, but the cohomological comparison is of interest to that field.
The award gave me time and financial resources for travel that allowed me to take more opportunities to give talks about my research, organize a conference,  as well as mentor graduate students. I regularly attended AWM events at the University of Utah and informally mentored grad students, helping them progress through their programs. I gave many talks at seminars in my field at various universities. I also spoke at the Geometry and Arithmetic of Surfaces Workshop at UW-Madison in Feb.~2019, which was particularly aimed at strengthening the network among graduate and early career mathematicians in underrepresented groups, and I was able to participate in the alumni scholar program at my alma mater, Grinnell College, where I gave an introductory talk about algebraic geometry and spoke to students about graduate school and careers in mathematics.
